availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Swope (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, agent)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, agent. Kentucky native. Father of Amanda Swope, Eliza Swope, Amauda Swope, and Josephine Swope. Married Matilda Maddon Swope in Spencer County, Kentucky on October 23, 1824. Resident in Louisiville, Kentucky in 1850. Agent in Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Juror in murder trial of Martin Pendergrast. Signed petition in December 1864 asking for his pardon.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 202.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisiville, p. 504. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Spencer County Marriages, Film 000482500. KYR-0001-004-1390.
